conclusion: There are four objects above the slabs, illuminated by a light source, casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
When the lamp is moved to a position that is higher, farther back, and to the left of the four objects, every shadow must slide in the opposite direction.

premise: Shadows always fall away from the light.
conclusion: Shadows will generally move forward-and-right on the floor plane when the light source is moved to the back left.

premise: Shadow A is cast by the white cloth.
conclusion: Shadow A now appears in front of the cloth and slightly to the viewer’s right.

premise: Shadow B is cast by the table mirror.
conclusion: Shadow B shifts to the mirror’s front-right; its stem and head still project a compact, oval-ish shadow but that oval is displaced forward-right.

premise: Shadow C is cast by the metal ring.
conclusion: Shadow C's thin ring outline stays circular, but the whole circle is translated forward-right of the ring.

premise: Shadow D is cast by the avocado.
conclusion: Shadow D, the small, pear-shaped patch, moves forward-right of the fruit.

premise: The light is relocated to the back-left.
conclusion: All four labelled shadows migrate to the front-right of their respective objects while retaining their individual shapes.
